refnamediv.refpurpose: program to select and download a Kirby kit

refsect1.title: DESCRIPTION
refsect1.para: This manual page documents briefly the &dhpackage; command, which is part of the kirbytools1 package.

&dhpackage; is a program that will download a Kirby package from Github to your local machine. You can choose between the starterkit and the plainkit package and you can select the version which should be downloaded. You can also specify the directory where the package will be downloaded to.

Default values for these options will be set by the kirbyconfigure1 program, which will be called upon first invocation of any of the kirbytools programs. The values will be saved in a file $HOME/.kirbyrc.

refsect1.title: OPTIONS
refsect1.para: The program follows the usual GNU command line syntax, options always starting with a dash (`-').

listitem.para: Extract the kirby program directory of the kit to a defined location. The location defaults to the value of KIRBYLIBDIR (appended with the versionnumber), which has been configured by the kirbyconfigure1 program and which is saved in the file $HOME/.kirbyrc.

This makes sense if you would like to create multiple virtual hosts which are based on one Kirby version. The kirby program directory will then only be linked into the virtual host folder. See https://getkirby.com/docs/cookbook/setup/multisite-variant for further details.
Force download even if the package is already downloaded.
Specify which Kirby kit to download. Defaults to the value of KIRBYKIT, which has been configured by the kirbyconfigure1 program and which is saved in the file $HOME/.kirbyrc.
Specify which Kirby version to download. Defaults to value of KIRBYVERSION, which has been configured by the kirbyconfigure1 program and which is saved in the file $HOME/.kirbyrc.
If current is selected, always the most recent version is downloaded. Otherwise a valid versionnumber has to be specified.
Specify the directory where downloads will be saved. Defaults to the value of KIRBYDOWNLOADDIR, which has been configured by the kirbyconfigure1 program and which is saved in the file $HOME/.kirbyrc.
The downloaded package is named package-version.tar.gz.

The system-wide configuration file to control the behaviour of &dhpackage;. See

The per-user configuration file to control the behaviour of &dhpackage;. See
foo.conf 5 for further details.
If used, the defined file is used as configuration file (see also ).

refsect1.title: DIAGNOSTICS
refsect1.para: The following diagnostics may be issued on stderr:

listitem.para: The configuration file seems to contain a broken configuration line. Use the --verbose option, to get more info.

refsect1.para: &dhpackage; provides some return codes, that can be used in scripts:

seglistitem.seg: The configuration file seems to be broken.

refsect1.title: BUGS
refsect1.para: The program is currently limited to only work with the foobar library.
